title: Main diagonal
summary: In linear algebra, the main diagonal (sometimes principal diagonal, primary diagonal, leading diagonal, major diagonal, or good diagonal) of a matrix A {\displaystyle A} is the list of entries a i , j {\displaystyle a_{i,j}} where i = j {\displaystyle i=j} . All off-diagonal elements are zero in a diagonal matrix. The following four matrices have their main diagonals indicated by red ones:
